item.title: Creating a forums Jmenu
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

Purpose: To create a new Jmenu, we will be creating a Forums tab for this tutorial
Difficulty: 2/10?
Requirments: A client with GUI.java, Common sense?

Today I will be showing you how to create a new Jmenu in a client. If you don’t what I’m talking about this is what it looks like,

o9fj36.jpg770×558

Step 1:
Open up your GUI.java and look for

private void initUI()
It should be near the top of the file. Scroll down a little bit and you should see something similiar to this
JMenuBar menuBar = new JMenuBar();

Step 2:
Under that hit enter and add this code in

JMenu forumMenu = new JMenu(“Forums”);
You can change the name around if you want. What this code does is phyiscally create the Forums tab.

Step 3:
Scroll down a little bit more until you see something like

String[] mainButtons = new String[]
The code should like something like this
String[] mainButtons = new String[]
{
“Change Server”, “Recent…”, “-”, “Quit”
};
or close to it. Under that create a new like and throw this code under it
String[] forumButtons = new String[]
{
“Moparscape”, “google”, “Silabsoft”
};
What this code does it when you click the Jmenu it brings down a pull down menu with those options on it.

Step 4:
Now scroll down a little bit more until you see a code similiar to this one

for (String name : mainButtons)
{
JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name);
if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-"))
fileMenu.addSeparator();
else
{
menuItem.addActionListener(this);
fileMenu.add(menuItem);
}
}

Create a new line and add this under it
for (String name : forumButtons)
{
JMenuItem menuItem = new JMenuItem(name);
if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-"))
forumMenu.addSeparator();
else
{
menuItem.addActionListener(this);
forumMenu.add(menuItem);
}
}
This creates a new like for each option we added above so they’re all on different lines.

Step 5:
Scroll down a little bit farther until you see this

menuBar.add(fileMenu);
under it add
menuBar.add(forumMenu);
What this does is create the pull down menu so you can choose from the different options.

Step 6:
Now for the last bit, making the options actually do something. Now if you’re familiar with server sided commands this should come easily to you to understand. Hit ctrl+F and search for

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
and you should see something like
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
{
String cmd = evt.getActionCommand(); 
	if (cmd != null) 
	{</blockquote>under the bracket of <blockquote>if (cmd != null) 
	{</blockquote>create a new line and add these codes in <blockquote>if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("Moparscape")) {
String url = "http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf";
	String browserPath = "http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf";
        	browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe";
        	url = "http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf";
        try {
             String[] b = {browserPath, url};
             Runtime.getRuntime().exec(b);
         }
         catch (Exception exc) {
      exc.printStackTrace();
         }
}

if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase(“google”)) {
String url = “http://www.google.org/forums.php”;
String browserPath = “http://www.google.org/forums.php”;
browserPath = “C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe”;
url = “http://www.google.org/forums.php”;
try {
String[] b = {browserPath, url};
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(b);
}
catch (Exception exc) {
exc.printStackTrace();
}
}
if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase(“Silabsoft”)) {
String url = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
String browserPath = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
browserPath = “C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe”;
url = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
try {
String[] b = {browserPath, url};
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(b);
}
catch (Exception exc) {
exc.printStackTrace();
}
}

So basically we just added in a client sided command that will direct you to to these sites if you click on the options. It works by connecting the String name of option to the command and whatever the command does.

So lets take a step back and look at these codes.
This

String url = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
this
String browserPath = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
and this
url = “http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php”;
All direct you to the desired site.
browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe";
This goes to the location of your internet explorer and opens it up and then the codes above direct you to it once its opened.

End Result:
View My Video

Thanks for viewing my tutorial! No flaming please. If you get any errors please feel free to post them here. Thanks again!

Credits:
Guitars595 (me)
Jagex (obvious reasons)
